title: Tesla Stock: Share Price Soars Despite German Market Slump
text:
Tesla Stock: Share Price Soars Despite German Market Slump
10.01.25 01:09
[Börse Global (en)](/news/category_site?site=bgen)
Tesla's stock demonstrates a remarkable disconnect from fundamental business metrics, surging 57 percent since November 2024 despite significant challenges in the German market. The company's new vehicle registrations in Germany plummeted by 40 percent compared to the previous year, dropping to approximately 38,000 units and reducing its market share to 9.9 percent. This decline outpaces the overall German electric vehicle market's 27 percent downturn. Despite these concerning figures, Tesla's stock reached an impressive all-time high of $479.86 before settling at around $394.94, highlighting the unique nature of Tesla's market position.
Investor Loyalty Defies Market Logic
The extraordinary stock performance can be attributed to an exceptionally devoted shareholder base that maintains its support even during periods of weakening sales figures. This unwavering loyalty enables Tesla's stock to diverge from conventional market dynamics, forging its own path regardless of competitive pressures from German automakers who continue to expand their electric vehicle market share. The phenomenon underscores Tesla's status as a cult stock that operates largely independently of traditional valuation criteria.
